Message.Title: President Nixon: Not bad.
Message.Msg: Ehrlichman: Edgar Kaiser is running his Permanente deal for profit. And the reason that he can—the reason he can do it—I had Edgar Kaiser come in—talk to me about this and I went into it in some depth. All the incentives are toward less medical care, because— —the less care they give them, the more money they make. —the less care they give them, the more money they make." Ehrlichman: [Unclear] and the incentives run the right way. President Nixon: Fine President Nixon: Not bad.

Message.Msg: You are a republican, thus an idiot.
Cheney hands out in front of the Free Clinic and consumes live abortions.

Those are the fundamental principles under which the US Veterans Administration has operated since the Presidency of Bill Clinton. In 1996 he opened "needs based" veterans programs and it flooded the system to the point where it broke. The VA was SUPPOSED to get automatic re-imbursement from Medicare for these patients, but that required an act of Congress as opposed to the Presidential Fiat by which he implemented the first half of the plan. Needless to say, and as Bill Clinton no doubt expected, Congress did NOT allow money to be taken from Medicare and as a result many Medicare and totally uninsured people who did perhaps 4 years total in the military started getting free health care at the local VA. President Bush put a stop to MOST needs based programs after the start of the Gulf War, but those that had thought to sign up in the meantime were grandfathered in. Bonuses to VA Administrators were shifted from being based on patient satisfaction surveys to based on how much they came in off their budget for the year as there is NO patient satisfaction at this time with most VA facilities, and with some they should be closed down and the staff, particularly administrative staff, purged and replaced with people who have "other" priorities. And NO MORE STUPID AFFIRMATIVE ACTION HIRING. Please!! The VA ends up getting the dregs of the nursing community because almost everything is affirmative action based in one way or another. President Obama, pushing Obamacare, once said he considered the Veterans Administration the model of socialized medicine because of how well it worked. This is how well it works. I'm a priority 1 100% disabled veteran and I have a list of things the VA is supposed to do (we're talking bare bones here) going back 10 years that they either haven't figured out how to do, it's "being worked on", or, frankly, whatever excuse for not doing it they can come up with at the moment. So, though was criticism intended, irony you did produce.

Topic.Title: Crazy Doesn't Even Describe This One...

Message.Msg: Yeah for leaving power tools plugged in so that idiotic customers could come along and test how sharp each was by cutting a bit off themselves. Think they'll publish which saw made the cleanest cuts? At the very least it should be an interesting bit in Consumer Reports. They'll all have to put up big signs "WARNING : Power Tools Are Dangerous". Not that anyone capable of reading the sign wouldn't be presumed to already know that. Or at the very least, if they don't, then they should be going off having an accident somewhere. Darwin has to get his props in or this species won't survive in a form we'd like to see. If anything we should take AWAY the safety nets so MORE people can die of stupidity.

Topic.Title: Thatcher stated there was no proof Iraq had wmd.

Message.Msg: "Iraq is a long way from here, but what happens there matters a great deal here. For the risks that the leaders of a rogue state will use nuclear, chemical or biological weapons against us or our allies is the greatest security threat we face." Madeleine Albright, Feb. 18, 1998. "He will use those weapons of mass destruction again, as he has ten times since 1983." Sandy Berger, Clinton National Security Adviser, Feb. 18, 1998. "We urge you, after consulting with Congress, and consistent with the U.S. Constitution and laws, to take necessary actions (including, if appropriate, air and missile strikes on suspect Iraqi sites) to respond effectively to the threat posed by Iraq's refusal to end its weapons of mass destruction programs." Letter to President Clinton, signed by Sens. Carl Levin, Tom Daschle, John Kerry, and others Oct. 9, 1998. "As a member of the House Intelligence Committee, I am keenly aware that the proliferation of chemical and biological weapons is an issue of grave importance to all nations. Saddam Hussein has been engaged in the development of weapons of mass destruction technology which is a threat to countries in the region and he has made a mockery of the weapons inspection process." Rep. Nancy Pelosi (D, CA), Dec. 16, 1998. “Earlier today, I ordered America's armed forces to strike military and security targets in Iraq. They are joined by British forces. Their mission is to attack Iraq's nuclear, chemical and biological weapons programs and its military capacity to threaten its neighbors.” President B. J. Clinton Dec. 16, 1998

Topic.Title: Thatcher stated there was no proof Iraq had wmd.

Message.Msg: Iraq had no wmd in 2003, and the UN stated that in jan 2003.....and even if they did, there was no reason or legal justification for the USA to attack....why not attack Israel or N Korea...they both do have wmd...

Topic.Title: Thatcher stated there was no proof Iraq had wmd.

Message.Msg: "Without question, we need to disarm Saddam Hussein. He is a brutal, murderous dictator, leading an oppressive regime .... He presents a particularly grievous threat because he is so consistently prone to miscalculation ... And now he is miscalculating America's response to his continued deceit and his consistent grasp for weapons of mass destruction .... So the threat of Saddam Hussein with weapons of mass destruction is real ...." Sen. John F. Kerry (D, MA), Jan. 23. 2003 UN never affirmatively stated that Saddam doesn't have WMDs. You deliberately overstated UN reports conclusions, i.e. lie.

Message.Title: Tax question for Daytraders
Message.Msg: 1) Can't download trades into turbo tax. Most likely because there are about 4,000 ! #$%$, how did that happen?! 2) Any suggestions? Anyone use Gainskeeper? It is mentioned in the Turbo tax tutorial? Cost? Can they download from my E-Trade account?

The year I do 4,000 trades is the year my wife kills me by August of the year after, UNLESS I made so much money I could hire a professional to do my schedule D. If YOU can have a professional take your trading records and JUST do the schedule D then you can just plug the number into TT and finish.

Message.Msg: I thank heaven each day for designing my nose so as to hold up my eye glasses! What kind of evolution would have forseen my need for spectacles and designed my nose and ears to hold them so perfectly! Sometimes I do wonder why my eyes were designed so poorly, blind spots and cataracts and all. I would have been blind by now 2000 years ago, but now I have the eye glasses my nose was designed for!
